subsubsection.title: Shoot
subsubsection.p: Should the hero be able to shoot in different directions or should be stick to a MegaMan like shooting?

subsubsection.title: Surround
subsubsection.p: Basically a turrican style surround shooting. Not sure how the thing will shoot (ice-freeze, flamethrower, normal). I kind of like it to behavice like a flamethrower to remove slime or other poison liquids on the ceiling or ground, which are immune against and unreachable with other weapons.

subsubsection.title: Run/Walk
subsubsection.p: We might have seperate walk and run actions (basically like in Super Mario), don't know if that will work out well, so we might end up with only a run action.

subsubsection.title: Climb
subsubsection.p: The Hero should be able to climb both wall and roof ladders.

subsubsection.title: Swim/Underwater
subsubsection.p: Swimming should basically be a 'endless' jump. You might also be able to simply walk underwater. [FIXME: This doesn't fit dogether with the otherwise planed realistic movement]

subsection.title: Weapons
subsection.p: Will we need different weapon stages like Turrican or static ones? (Weaponstage <-> Hero's energie!?)

subsubsection.title: Jetpack
subsubsection.p: The game will have a jetpack, I am currently not sure if we have it as a item which you can use all the time or just in some special events/levels.

subsubsection.title: Smart Bomb - Shockwave
subsubsection.p: Turrican 2 style, but maybe circular, which basically means that the bomb will not erase anything on the screen, but only these enemies which are reachable from the heros position.

subsubsection.title: Respawning
subsubsection.p: Big enemies, final bosses and similar things should not respawn. Small standard enemies should respawn at specific events (level/section change).

subsection.title: Levels
subsection.p: The game will not be sperated into normal levels, instead it will consist of 'sections', where one can more or less move freely around. Translating between section will be done via special events (like the water-thing in another world) or via doors (where one has to find the keys before passing them). Moving forward and backward should basically possible, but there might be points-of-no-return. Some kind of guidance system should always show you where to go, so that one doesn't lost himself in a level.

subsubsection.title: Ice
subsubsection.p: might protect against ice water and give better grip on ice

subsubsection.title: Fire/Lava
subsubsection.p: protect better against lava and hot regions

subsection.title: Level File Format
subsection.p: The level file format will be at its basic level tile based, support for multiple overlapping tiles would be nice, the tile size will be 128x128. In addition the map might support brushes, meaning you can insert (animated) surface objects at arbitrary positions, not sure how this will influence the collision map.

subsubsection.title: Collision Map
subsubsection.p: needs to be modifiable, should use a tilesize of 8x8 pixels (the smallest possible world object). How to we integrade non-flat ground? Might need more than one pixel type. Water, Lava must also be handled by this map.

subsection.title: Backgrounds
subsection.p: We will support multiple paralax scrolling layers of backgrounds. The implementation will/should be similar to Pingus.

subsection.title: Cutscenes
subsection.p: Not sure what we need here

subsection.title: In game Events
subsection.p: Not sure what we need here.

subsection.title: Dialogs
subsection.p: We should provide some kind of primitive dialog support, nothing complicated, simple yes/no dialogs might do it.

subsection.title: Controller - Gamepad Mappings
subsection.p: The game will be designed for use with a 8 button pad (4 action button, 1 pause button, 1 select, 2 shoulder button)
A flewible controller api should be provided for remapping the buttons to specific gamepads.

subsection.title: Items
subsection.p: We might include items which can trigger specific switches, cutscenes or story events. They might also be used to open doors, detonate walls or similar things. Item selection should be similar to weapon select (a rotating pie-menu)

subsection.title: Layers
subsection.p: The game engine should be build up-on different abstraction layers, each of these should only depend on the previous layer and should be mainly independet of the game itself, so allowing to reuse it for other games.

ul.li: 4. Layer -> The Game itself, enemies special effects

subsection.title: Releases
subsection.p: I am not sure how releases will be handled. Release 1.0.0 should be a fully playable and complete version, other versions should also be playable, but maybe not all. Development releases/ technical previews should be seperated from playable demos and should provide a special interface which lets you select level, intros, etc. The init/intro screen should show that the current version is not playable.
It might take three years or longer until a fully playable version is ready, demos might be ready a few weeks after I started coding.

section.title: Tiles
section.p: Tiles in Windstille are 128x128 pixel large, there collision handling however happens at 16x16 pixels. This means that a tile is seperated into 8x8 subtiles.

Which of these subtiles is collidable and which isn't is setup in the data/tiles.scm file. So to create a tile one needs to paint a 128x128 large tile and make sure that any edges of it align with the 16x16 subtiles so that collision handling can go smoothly. A little overlap is ok and necessary to make it look good, but the player shouldn't be allowed to 'walk in stone', so overlap shouldn't get to huge. The yellow areas above mark transition-subtiles, aka. tiles that are only half collidable and present a 45 degree angle.
